attributes.action: introduce a new rights bill to protect naturists from discrimination
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Naturists often face negative discrimination, both in the workplace and in their local communities.

The government should protect the rights of naturists and should aim to educate the general population about the merits of naturists in the community.  Naturists are interesting, down-to-earth people and I think they deserve protecting.  Why should they have to travel to campsites in France to exercise their lifestyle choices?  Everyone has a right to live their life how they like, obviously excluding murder/assaults etc.  

Naturists are not 'dirty'; this is a common misconception.

The lack of public education surrounding the pursuit of the Naturist only serves to stiffle the population-diversity of our nation.

rejection.details: There is a similar petition at: http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/nudecouncils/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
